lexUnit.name: squander.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: waste in a reckless or foolish manner

sentence.text: Because they had squandered all their cash , they each had bank overdrafts of around Â£1,500 .
Bangor failed to break the deadlock in the 15th and 26th minutes when Paul Gray and Stephen Hill squandered two good chances .

Pool found themselves being hard pressed by as after taking an early lead through Michael Smithies , they squandered several good scoring chances before scrambling home by the only goal of the match .
In the style of his father he squandered the Vernon fortune and he alienated his wife .
The young Duke squanders his enormous fortune in commissioning Sir Carte Blanche to remodel his palace in town and his genuinely Gothic castle .

Rather than buying fewer pictures of greater quality , Croce has squandered his considerable funds in speculations , favouring the ` bargains " , i.e. the mis-catalogued ` workshop " pictures that would ( hopefully ) improve dramatically with cleaning , or pictures that were authentic , but not particularly fine or interesting .
He squandered his money on the indulgence of all his desires .
I must admit I liked her ; she wo n't squander her grandfather 's money , that 's for sure .
But as the game 's tempo reached fever pitch , Saunders squandered a golden opportunity to grab an equaliser .
` It is manifestly unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate excess goods , squandering available resources while masses of people are living in conditions of misery .
It does not make sense to squander important resources that the nation can ill afford to lose .
Business people who want their country to become more like the West are frustrated by the way Russian entrepreneurs squander their profits on expensive cars .
He declared that " by squandering a quarter of our budget on military expenditure we have ruined the country " .
Now they 've lifted the ban on my going abroad , I 'm off to Argentina next month to squander his millions on some really good ponies . "
Too much decentralised buying by the National Health Service means the service squanders millions by failing to use bulk orders to get the cheapest prices , the National Audit Office claimed .
However , that money was squandered .
` Billions of pounds have been squandered that could have been invested in energy conservation and the development of alternatives . "
It has caused collection problems on a hitherto unprecedented scale , and more than Â£100 million worth of taxpayers ' money has been squandered on administering the wretched tax in Wales alone .
The Bank of England squandered a huge chunk of Britain 's precious foreign currency reserves in a vain bid to prop it up .
Apparently the servant girl he married squandered every penny of his and Elizabeth says she has no pity for her now she 's destitute . "
